resources.string: Plus many button initiates a fake background work that lasts a few seconds and increments the counter by 1, then by 2, and then by 1.\n\nThe time it takes varies and you can run multiple of them at the same time.
Hello there! Press the button to dismiss this dialog!
Opening a dialog can be useful to understand the difference between started and resumed behaviour.

The best way to understand what is happening here is opening logcat and filtering for "lifecyle counter".

Each field is updated in a slightly different way. The first is always updated (could create problems while the app is in the background). The second is only updated while the activity is started and the third while the activity is resumed.

In order to see the differences between them, you can open logcat with the filter and then try opening a dialog (activity pauses) or leave the app (activity stops).

Additionally, if you press back, you destroy the acticity and all updates stop.
